docs.abstract: President Abdus Sattar of Bangladesh left today for a four-day state visit to Saudi Arabia. He was accompanied by his foreign and finance ministers and other top officials.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Abdus Sattar of Bangladesh left today for a four-day state visit to Saudi Arabia. He was accompanied by his foreign and finance ministers and other top officials.

docs.abstract: The Supreme Court today rejected the final appeals of death sentences for 12 Bangladesh army officers charged with mutiny and the assassination of President Ziaur Rahman last May. It is believed that the sentences will be carried out as soon as the verdict is officially relayed to Government authorities.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court today rejected the final appeals of death sentences for 12 Bangladesh army officers charged with mutiny and the assassination of President Ziaur Rahman last May. It is believed that the sentences will be carried out as soon as the verdict is officially relayed to Government authorities.

docs.abstract: A new gas field with possible reserves of one trillion cubic feet has been found at Feni, about 80 miles from here, acording to the Bengali Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources, said.
docs.lead_paragraph: A new gas field with possible reserves of one trillion cubic feet has been found at Feni, about 80 miles from here, acording to the Bengali Ministry of Petroleum and Mineral Resources, said.

docs.abstract: The International Monetary Fund, which has recently come under pressure from the Reagan Administration to tighten its lending policies, has cracked down on one of the poorest countries in the world - Bangladesh.   The I.M.F. suspended payments in July on a three-year $912 million loan given to Bangladesh only seven months before. The fund cited that country's failure to cut Government spending and scale back food subsidy programs.   As a result of the suspension, Bangladesh has lost $100 million in funds it had expected this year, forcing the Government to line up $200 million in short-term credits with several commercial finance companies, including American Express, Manufacturers Hanover Trust and Morgan Guaranty.
docs.lead_paragraph: The International Monetary Fund, which has recently come under pressure from the Reagan Administration to tighten its lending policies, has cracked down on one of the poorest countries in the world - Bangladesh.

byline.original: By Ann Crittenden, Special To the New York Times

docs.abstract: The death toll from a tornado yesterday in southern Bangladesh was put at 41 today but rescuers feared it would rise.
docs.lead_paragraph: The death toll from a tornado yesterday in southern Bangladesh was put at 41 today but rescuers feared it would rise.

docs.abstract: Wars between Moslems and Hindus have been erupting on the subcontinent for centuries. In the 12th century Moslem invaders brought Islam to Bengal, which is now part of Bangladesh, and the Moslem rulers remained until the British arrived in the 18th century. In 1947, predominantly Hindu India won independence from Britain and a separate Moslem state, Pakistan, was created in two parts divided by 1,000 miles of Indian territory. With power centered in West Pakistan, the more populous East Pakistan demanded greater economic benefits and political change. Rioting broke out in the East in 1968. In 1970 the separatists in the East won a majority in the National Assembly and called for more independence, but Assembly sessions were postponed by Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan, who was then President.  Rioting in the East erupted into civil war and Bangladesh was declared independent, forcing the resignation of Mr. Yahya Khan.  Sheik Mujibur Rahman, a leader of the Bengali nationalists in the East, became Prime Minister but was killed in a 1975 coup. His successor was also deposed, and Maj. Gen. Ziaur Rahman, who was assassinated yesterday, became the martial law leader in 1976 and President
docs.lead_paragraph: Wars between Moslems and Hindus have been erupting on the subcontinent for centuries. In the 12th century Moslem invaders brought Islam to Bengal, which is now part of Bangladesh, and the Moslem rulers remained until the British arrived in the 18th century. In 1947, predominantly Hindu India won independence from Britain and a separate Moslem state, Pakistan, was created in two parts divided by 1,000 miles of Indian territory. With power centered in West Pakistan, the more populous East Pakistan demanded greater economic benefits and political change. Rioting broke out in the East in 1968. In 1970 the separatists in the East won a majority in the National Assembly and called for more independence, but Assembly sessions were postponed by Agha Mohammad Yahya Khan, who was then President. Rioting in the East erupted into civil war and Bangladesh was declared independent, forcing the resignation of Mr. Yahya Khan. Sheik Mujibur Rahman, a leader of the Bengali nationalists in the East, became Prime Minister but was killed in a 1975 coup. His successor was also deposed, and Maj. Gen. Ziaur Rahman, who was assassinated yesterday, became the martial law leader in 1976 and President

docs.abstract: If there are worse places than Bangladesh these days, much credit goes to Ziaur Rahman. From his rise to power in 1975 until his assassination last weekend, General Zia instilled new motivation in the New England-sized nation of 92 million people to produce more food and fewer children.   His murder by army rivals raised fears in Dacca of another period of political instability and bloodshed like the one that occurred after the army overthrew Sheik Mujibur Rahman, Bangladesh's first President, in 1975.
docs.lead_paragraph: If there are worse places than Bangladesh these days, much credit goes to Ziaur Rahman. From his rise to power in 1975 until his assassination last weekend, General Zia instilled new motivation in the New England-sized nation of 92 million people to produce more food and fewer children.

headline.main: Everyone Loses In Bangladesh Coup Attempt
headline.print_headline: THE WORLD; Everyone Loses In Bangladesh Coup Attempt

docs.abstract: At first glance, the recent news from Bangladesh seems only to confirm that nation's pathetic image. Born out of a fracturing of Pakistan only a decade ago, Bangladesh early on gained a reputation as an international ''basket case,'' a metaphor for misery and hopelessness.
docs.lead_paragraph: At first glance, the recent news from Bangladesh seems only to confirm that nation's pathetic image. Born out of a fracturing of Pakistan only a decade ago, Bangladesh early on gained a reputation as an international ''basket case,'' a metaphor for misery and hopelessness.

docs.abstract: The Bangladesh Government announced tonight that it had arrested 20 army officers involved in the plot last weekend to overthrow the Government and that three of them, including the leader, had been killed shortly after being taken into custody.   President Ziaur Rahman, who was killed in the attempted coup Saturday morning, was buried in Dacca after a long, solemn funeral procession attended by hundreds of thousands of grieving people, many of them in tears and shouting slogans.   The Government announcement left unclear the exact circumstances in which the three officers - Maj. Gen. Mohammed Abdul Manzur and two lieutenant colonels - had died.   According to the Government announcement, reports from Chittagong, where the rebellion took place, said that with the help of local people, the three rebellious officers had been tracked to a ''hideout in the jungle,'' in the southeast corner of the country.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Bangladesh Government announced tonight that it had arrested 20 army officers involved in the plot last weekend to overthrow the Government and that three of them, including the leader, had been killed shortly after being taken into custody.

byline.original: By William Borders, Special To the New York Times

docs.abstract: President Abdus Sattar won nearly 66 percent of the vote in the presidential election Sunday, official returns showed today.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Abdus Sattar won nearly 66 percent of the vote in the presidential election Sunday, official returns showed today.

headline.main: President of Bangladesh Takes 66% of Vote
headline.print_headline: AROUND THE WORLD; President of Bangladesh Takes 66% of Vote
